column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The museum has a selection of pieces that you should hit if you are limited on time. I would definitely go a weekday since these pieces will be surrounded by people taking selfies. Get close and personal with Seurats Sunday Afternoon
column3: Caillebotte's Paris Street and walk through the Ando's screens. There was a lovely exhibit in the contemporary wing that allowed you to take your shoes off and walk on sand. I'm not a huge fan of contemporary art but I love experiencing the pieces close like this.
